page.title: 17RELIGION
page.content: {Necton Baptist church}celebrated its Bicentenial in 1985.In 1785 a Mr. and Mrs Bunn were given permission to build a Baptist Church as there were nine Baptists who worshipped together in the area, and in 1834 Necton was one of the first 21 churches to join the East Norfolk Baptist Association. The first recognised paster in 1804 was Rev. John Carter. During this time an adult school was started and lessons in reading, arithmetic and writing for children. The building is rather square and built of brick which has now been rendered with concrete. Inside is the chapel with a pulpit and organ, and a gallery runs around three sides of the chapel. There are 11 members of the church and services are held weekly with Communion and Bible Study monthly.
